review: It's a piece of junk, does several things just wrong, just a poor design but I'm still giving it 5 stars because with a good wifi connection it does allot more than it's advertised to do. If you read the adds it looks like it's a Netflix box and Netflix is what makes it worth buying, but add google chrome on a laptop it's one of the best $30 purchases you'll make. Stream anything, control Netflix with your cell phone. Buy 2 and name the TV's. anyone with a smart phone, tablet, or computer can control any tv. It's just like using a network printer... but easier.

review: I purchased this as a gift for my hubby, but everyone enjoys it in my house.  We have 2 smart tvs with amazon, hulu, netflix etc in our house, not to forget at&t; uverse.  Bought it mainly because hubby uses an app to watch european tv and I wanted him to be able to watch it in the big screen.  This was the perfect gift.  There are many apps, including netflix that have the cast button.  We find that we mainly do the cast screen, which is like a screen mirroring in Beta version.  Now, we use it to view the same apps/programs we view via the android phone or tablet, but also to view videos that we have in the NAS.  I love the wireless streaming.  I use ES Explorer to browse my NAS and just cast the screen to the tv and voila! Sound and quality are marvelous, couldnt ask for more.  I am thinking about buying another one so I do not have to move them around between tvs, and also as a house warming gift for friend.The usb is pretty small and comes with a long enough cable that if your tv doesnt have a usb you can add it to a charger.In summary for the $34 it is a steal.  The sound and video quality are good, well of course as good as video you are "casting".  The phone or tablet because like the remote control.
